content:
When jammy was released, it was kind of a surprise for our community. Let's be a little more prepared when 24.04 noble arrives, tentatively end of April.

I presume that OpenCPN 5.10 will arrive about the same date.

First issue: I suggest that we drop bionic more or less now, heading for supporting focal, jammy and noble in next cycle.

Sometime after the holidays we should probably start ci builds for noble.

Thoughts?
@Pavel Kalian @Dave Register

I don't build my plugins for it at all and don't see children crying at my doorstep, so as far as I'm concerned, Bionic can go. The sooner we add support for 24.04 in the CI toolchain, the better, adapting it in the plugin ecosystem will be much easier this time, but still needs to be done.
Re 5.10 release date, depends on what we want to get into it... If we are late, adding support for Noble in 5.8 and doing another point release should be doable without major pain I hope.

The sooner we add support for 24.04 in the CI toolchain, the better, adapting it in the plugin ecosystem will be much easier this time

At least for shipdriver this is already done, we build the bookworm plugins which will be used on 24.04.
Let's wait and see what Dave thinks, he is the one who usually is insisting on supporting older distros.

I am ready to drop bionic.
In April 2024, bionic will be 6 years old, two viable interim LTS releases still valid (focal, jammy).
Bionic is indeed ancient history.
All the FE2 plugins will be ready for Bookworm, so Noble should be smooth going, I expect.
Except....Wayland, if they go that way.

They are already on wayland, at least since jammy. Wayland is just a protocol, and as such no problem Furthermore, the most used compositor is mutter which has a working X11 emulation from our POV

The problem is the Wayfire compositor used by Raspbian. This is about Raspbian but has nothing to do with Ubuntu using the default Gnome desktop

So, let's drop bionic
For plugins, this means dropping the last traces of support for Buster
FWIW, I expect we will have continuing anecdotal problems around Wayland. Some users tend to like alternative Desktop Managers, some of which use alternative compositors...
I'll drop bionic plugins when we start Beta on O5.10
